newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for July 2.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for July 2.

text.p: All Mexican ports were open on Wednesday, the Communications and Transport Ministry (SCT) said in its 1000 local/1500 GMT daily meteorological report.
The ministry updated port conditions and shipping warnings for the Pacific Coast, Gulf of Mexico and Caribbean.
Clear skies and warm weather with maximum winds 10 to 15 knots (19 to 28 km/11 to 16 miles per hour) and waves three to six feet high. In Oaxaca and Chiapas thunder showers and heavy rains.

Storms and strong rains in Colima, Jalisco and Michoacan states because of Tropical Depression Carlos, which was located about 900 km (562 miles) off Mexico's Pacific coast. The ministry continued to warn against shipping near regional islands.
Clear skies in northern region, with light to moderate rains and winds along the coasts of Tamaulipas, Veracruz and Campeche Sound. Winds from 10 to 15 knots and waves three to five feet high.
Partly cloudy and rainy along the coasts of Quintana Roo, Belize and the Yucatan channel, with winds at 10 to 15 knots and waves three to five feet high.
